dt: {bc}to determine or fix the value of
{bc}to determine the significance, worth, or condition of usually by careful appraisal and study

pt: {sc}estimate{/sc} {sc}appraise{/sc} {sc}evaluate{/sc} {sc}value{/sc} {sc}rate{/sc} {sc}assess{/sc} mean to judge something with respect to its worth or significance. {sc}estimate{/sc} implies a judgment, considered or casual, that precedes or takes the place of actual measuring or counting or testing out.
{sc}appraise{/sc} commonly implies the fixing by an expert of the monetary worth of a thing, but it may be used of any critical judgment.
{sc}evaluate{/sc} suggests an attempt to determine relative or intrinsic worth in terms other than monetary.
{sc}value{/sc} equals {sc}appraise{/sc} but without implying expertness of judgment.

pt.t: a watercolor {it}valued{/it} by the donor at $500

pt: {sc}rate{/sc} adds to {sc}estimate{/sc} the notion of placing a thing according to a scale of values.
{sc}assess{/sc} implies a critical appraisal for the purpose of understanding or interpreting, or as a guide in taking action.

pt.t: officials are trying to {it}assess{/it} the damage

et: back-formation from {it}evaluation{/it}, from French {it}évaluation{/it}, from Middle French {it}evaluacion{/it}, from {it}esvaluer{/it} to evaluate, from {it}e-{/it} + {it}value{/it} value
shortdef: to determine or fix the value of
to determine the significance, worth, or condition of usually by careful appraisal and study

dt: {bc}to {d_link|evaluate|evaluate} oneself or one's actions, performance, etc.

dt.t: … students are given the opportunity to {wi}self-evaluate{/wi} their own work …
Asked to {wi}self-evaluate{/wi} himself, Conner was quick to answer …
Ask what went wrong. This encourages kids to {wi}self-evaluate{/wi}, says [parenting expert Judy] Arnall.
… he and the staff did a lot of {wi}self-evaluating{/wi} and research into ways they could improve the operation and serve more people.

utxt.t: Accurate {wi}self-evaluation{/wi} and the ability to take a step back and figure out why something worked or didn't work was important.
Applicants for the Torch Award must perform a detailed {wi}self-evaluation{/wi} to examine their decision-making processes and business practices.
{wi}Self-evaluations{/wi} were collected and the teacher provided written feedback about the {wi}self-evaluations{/wi} the following day.

shortdef: to evaluate oneself or one's actions, performance, etc.

dt: {bc}to {d_link|evaluate|evaluate} (something or someone) again especially with regard to changes or new information

dt.t: Debts force students to delay marriage, postpone children and {wi}reevaluate{/wi} career choices.
If you are out of work, maybe this is a good time to slow down and {wi}reevaluate{/wi} your priorities.
The time has come, I believe, for us to {wi}re-evaluate{/wi} teaching …
He said … that council will have time later to {wi}reevaluate{/wi} if the Cooksville Creek owners don't budge.

utxt.t: Intense {wi}reevaluation{/wi} of the field's traditional subject matter—and also of its methods of observation and explanation—has plunged cultural anthropology into a profound state of crisis.

shortdef: to evaluate (something or someone) again especially with regard to changes or new information
